title: Arts & Entertainment
description: Learn vocabulary for discussing art, music, film, literature, and cultural events.

words.meaning: an outstanding work of art
words.example: The painting is considered a masterpiece of Renaissance art.

words.meaning: a category of art or literature
words.example: Science fiction is my favorite film genre.

words.meaning: a public display of art or objects
words.example: The museum is hosting an exhibition of modern sculptures.

words.meaning: an act of presenting entertainment
words.example: The orchestra gave a stunning performance last night.

words.meaning: a person who writes music
words.example: Beethoven is one of the greatest composers in history.

words.meaning: a person who writes plays
words.example: Shakespeare is the most famous playwright in English literature.

words.meaning: a three-dimensional work of art
words.example: The sculpture was carved from a single block of marble.

words.meaning: a painting or photograph of a person
words.example: The artist painted a beautiful portrait of the queen.

words.meaning: belonging to the present time
words.example: The gallery specializes in contemporary art.

words.meaning: not representing reality directly
words.example: Abstract art often focuses on shapes and colors rather than objects.

words.meaning: having great influence on others
words.example: Picasso was one of the most influential artists of the 20th century.

words.meaning: attracting and holding attention
words.example: The film had a captivating storyline.

words.meaning: bringing strong feelings or memories to mind
words.example: The music was evocative of summer days.

words.meaning: highly praised by critics
words.example: The film was critically acclaimed but failed at the box office.

words.meaning: a highly successful and popular production
words.example: The movie became the summer's biggest blockbuster.

words.meaning: the first public performance of a work
words.example: The film had its world premiere at the festival.

words.meaning: to explain the meaning of something
words.example: Critics interpret the painting as a commentary on society.

words.meaning: to represent in a picture or performance
words.example: The actor portrayed the historical figure brilliantly.

words.meaning: to fill with creative or emotional motivation
words.example: The landscape inspired many of her paintings.

words.meaning: to show or represent in a picture or words
words.example: The novel depicts life in rural Japan.

words.meaning: to practice for a public performance
words.example: The cast rehearsed the play for weeks before opening night.

words.meaning: a detailed analysis and assessment
words.example: The professor wrote a critique of the artist's work.

words.meaning: relating to beauty or artistic taste
words.example: The building has great aesthetic appeal.

words.meaning: the music accompanying a film
words.example: The soundtrack won an award for best original score.

words.meaning: a story or account of events
words.example: The film has a complex narrative structure.

words.meaning: the use of symbols to represent ideas
words.example: The director used symbolism throughout the film.

words.meaning: new and experimental in style
words.example: The artist is known for her avant-garde approach.

words.meaning: the main character in a story
words.example: The protagonist struggles with moral dilemmas throughout the novel.

words.meaning: the art of photography and camera work in film
words.example: The cinematography was breathtaking.

words.meaning: able to adapt to many different functions
words.example: She is a versatile actress who can play any role.

words.meaning: a collection of works that an artist can perform
words.example: The pianist has a wide repertoire of classical pieces.

words.meaning: a group of musicians, actors, or dancers performing together
words.example: The ensemble performed a beautiful symphony.

words.meaning: to create and perform spontaneously without preparation
words.example: Jazz musicians often improvise during performances.

words.meaning: to add notes to a melody to form chords
words.example: The choir harmonized beautifully on the final verse.

words.meaning: the sequence of steps and movements in dance
words.example: The choreography for the ballet was intricate and graceful.

words.meaning: a long speech by one actor in a play
words.example: The actor delivered a powerful monologue in the final scene.

words.meaning: an introduction to a book or play
words.example: The prologue sets the scene for the story that follows.

words.meaning: a concluding section that rounds out the design of a literary work
words.example: The epilogue reveals what happens to the characters years later.

words.meaning: a keeper or custodian of a museum or art collection
words.example: The curator selected paintings for the new exhibition.

words.meaning: an exhibition or compilation showing the development of an artist's work
words.example: The museum held a retrospective of the photographer's career.

words.meaning: a revival of art and literature
words.example: The Italian Renaissance produced many great artists.

words.meaning: a person who oversees camera work and lighting in filmmaking
words.example: The cinematographer won an Oscar for his work on the film.

words.meaning: a person who supervises the actors and crew in film or theatre
words.example: The director gave clear instructions to the actors.

words.meaning: a person who judges the merits of literary or artistic works
words.example: The critic wrote a negative review of the play.

words.meaning: a person highly skilled in music or another artistic pursuit
words.example: The young violinist is already considered a virtuoso.

words.meaning: the text of an opera or musical
words.example: Mozart composed the music while Da Ponte wrote the libretto.

words.meaning: the written form of a musical composition
words.example: The conductor studied the score before the rehearsal.

words.meaning: a painting done on wet plaster on a wall or ceiling
words.example: Michelangelo painted the famous fresco on the Sistine Chapel ceiling.

words.meaning: a picture or pattern made from small pieces of colored material
words.example: The Byzantine church features stunning mosaic artwork.

words.meaning: a collection of poems or literary pieces
words.example: The anthology contains works by various contemporary poets.

exercises.answer: 비평가들은 그 그림을 사회에 대한 논평으로 해석한다.

exercises.answer: 그 풍경은 그녀의 많은 그림에 영감을 주었다.

exercises.answer: 그 소설은 일본 시골의 삶을 묘사한다.

exercises.answer: 출연진은 개막일 전에 몇 주 동안 연극을 리허설했다.

exercises.answer: 그 예술가는 그녀의 아방가르드 접근법으로 알려져 있다.

exercises.question: The cinematography was breathtaking.

exercises.question: Mozart composed the music while Da Ponte wrote the libretto.
exercises.answer: 모차르트가 음악을 작곡하는 동안 다 폰테가 대본을 썼다.

exercises.question: The conductor studied the score before the rehearsal.

exercises.question: The Byzantine church features stunning mosaic artwork.
exercises.answer: 비잔틴 교회는 놀라운 모자이크 예술 작품을 특징으로 한다.

exercises.answer: 그 선집은 다양한 현대 시인들의 작품을 포함하고 있다.

exercises.answer: The exhibition was a retrospective showing the artist's life work.

exercises.answer: The film director supervises everything on set.

exercises.answer: The critic wrote a positive review of the new film.

exercises.question: The dance company performs a diverse repertoire.

exercises.question: The anthology includes poetry from around the world.
exercises.answer: 그 선집은 전 세계의 시를 포함하고 있다.

exercises.question: The Renaissance period was a time of great artistic achievement.
exercises.answer: 르네상스 시대는 위대한 예술적 성취의 시기였다.
